intro: Alsine tenuifolia proles confertiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered narrowleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with small, succulent leaves that are typically narrow and linear. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale blue flowers arranged in dense inflorescences, which are often found near the base of the stems. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. This species is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is commonly found in regions with Mediterranean or desert climates.
